_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The MPLX LLC Jackson LP Terminal is a refined petroleum product distributor. The Jackson LP Terminal is an on-shore, light products, bulk petroleum storage terminal used in the storage and distribution of petroleum products to retail and commercial end-users in the vicinity of Jackson, MI.   The Terminal handles and stores various grades of unleaded gasoline, low sulfur diesel/#2 fuel oil, butane, ethanol, and various other petroleum based additives.

Jackson LP Terminal is committed to operating and maintaining processes in a safe, reliable and environmentally sound manner. MPLX believes that excellent performance in health, safety, and the environment goes hand in hand with operating reliably, and that outstanding HES performance is of paramount importance.

The Terminal is designed, operated and maintained in a manner that protects the environment, as well as the health and safety of its employees, contractors and the community. MPLX promotes health, safety, and the environment through programs of awareness, compliance, prevention and protection. These programs include a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning. This document provides a brief overview of the comprehensive risk management activities that MPLX has designed and implemented, including:

A. A description of the facility and the use of regulated substances
B. An overview of the accidental release prevention programs
C. A five-year accident history for accidental releases of regulated chemicals
D. An overview of the emergency response program
E. An overview of planned changes to improve safety

A. STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES

The butane tank blending process has been classified as Program Level 3. No Program 1 or 2 processes containing regulated substances were identified.  By virtue of the flammable effects associated with butane, it is necessary to observe certain safety precautions in handling butane to prevent unnecessary human exposure, to reduce t

tion Association's (NFPA's) Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) Code (NFPA-58) requirements for LP Gas. In addition to the presence of appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of butane, a Emergency Response Action Plan (ERAP)/"SmartPlan" is in place for the Facility and response activities are coordinated with Blackman-Leoni Department of Public Safety.

C. FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

The Jackson LP Terminal has an excellent record of accident prevention. The Terminal maintains records for all incidental and significant chemical releases inclusive of any root cause analyses and associated, follow-up actions. This is a "newly regulated" process; consequently, there have been no accidents within the past five (5) years resulting from the release of materials covered under the EPA RMP regulations.

D. EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

The Facility's emergency response plans are coordinated with the Blackman-Leoni Department of Public Safety and Jackson County Emergency Management. An Emergency Response Action Plan (ERAP)/"SmartPlan" is in place to inform employees what to do in case of a release, fire, and to notify emergency responders when there is a need for a response.

In the event of an emergency involving the butane tank blending system, it is the policy of the Facility to initially contact the Blackman-Leoni Department of Public Safety and request their assistance. The Facility maintains a trained (annually) incipient fire and 1st Responder Operations capability.

The Blackman-Leoni Department of Public Safety participates in annual butane training sessions for this system.

E.  PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

MPLX is continually striving to make the Jackson LP Terminal the safest and most reliable workplace possible for its employees, neighbors, and community.

In an effort to improve and promote system safety, MPLX actively seeks employee input on process safety improvements.  All process safety events (as identified in API 754) are electronically recorded,
reviewed, and/or investigated via a root cause analysis (TapRooT) per MPC policy.  Additionally, MPLX will work cooperatively with the community to address any concerns.
